request.description:
**GET /v2/accounts/{id}** - Returns a json structure containing the details of the requested account.

**Required Fields**
	
id: ID of the account

**Optional Fields**

on\_behalf\_of: ID of contact

**Response**
	
id: ID of the account

account\_name: Name of the account

brand: The brand that is associated with this account

your\_reference: Your unique customer ID

status: Status of the account

street: First line of the address

city: City

state\_or\_province: Name of State or Province

country: Country

postal\_code: Post Code or Zip code

spread\_table: Name of spread table

created\_at: ISO 8601 Date when the Account was created

updated\_at: ISO 8601 Date when the Account was last updated

identification\_type: name of ID type

identification\_value: ID value

short\_reference: shortened reference

**POST /v2/accounts/{id}** - Updates an existing account and returns a json structure containing the details of the requested account.

**Required Fields**

**Optional Fields**

brand: The brand to associate with this account

your\_reference: Your unique customer ID

status: Status of the account

street: Street address

city: City

state\_or\_province: Name of state or province

postal\_code: Post Code or Zip Code

country: A two-letter country codes as defined in ISO 3166-1

spread\_table: Name of spread table

identification\_type: name of ID type

identification\_value: ID value

**Response**
	
id: ID of the account

account\_name: Name of the account

brand: The brand that is associated with this account

your\_reference: Your unique customer ID

legal\_entity\_type	

status: Status of the account

street: First line of the address

city: City

state\_or\_province: Name of state or province 

country: Country

postal\_code: Post Code or Zip code

spread\_table: Name of spread table

created\_at: ISO 8601 Date when the Account was created

updated\_at: ISO 8601 Date when the Account was last updated

identification\_type: name of ID type

identification\_value: ID value

short\_reference: Shortened reference

**POST /v2/accounts/create** - Creates a new account and returns a json structure containing the details of the requested account.

**Required Fields**

account\_name: Name of the account

**Optional Fields**

brand: The brand to associate with this account

your\_reference: Your unique customer ID

status: Status of the account. If nothing is supplied, the default setting is enabled

street: Street address

state\_or\_province: name of state or province

city: City

postal\_code: Post Code or Zip Code

country: A two-letter country codes as defined in ISO 3166-1

spread\_table: Name of spread table

identification\_type: name of ID type

identification\_value: ID value

**Response**
	
id: ID of the account

account\_name: Name of the account

brand: The brand that is associated with this account

your\_reference: Your unique customer ID

legal\_entity\_type	

status: Status of the account

street: First line of the address

city: City

state\_or\_province: name of state or province

country: Country

postal\_code: Post Code or Zip code

spread\_table: Name of spread table

created\_at: ISO 8601 Date when the Account was created

updated\_at: ISO 8601 Date when the Account was last updated

identification\_type: name of ID type

identification\_value: ID value

short\_reference: shortened reference

**GET /v2/accounts/find** - Return an array containing json structures of details of the accounts matching the search criteria for the logged in user.


**Optional Fields**

account\_name: Name of the account

brand: The brand to associate with this account

your\_reference: Your unique customer ID

status: Status of the account

street: Street address

city: City

state\_or\_province: Name of state or province

postal\_code: Post Code or Zip Code

country: A two-letter country codes as defined in ISO 3166-1

spread\_table: Name of spread table

page: Which page to show

per\_page: Maximum number of entries to return

order: The field to order entries by

order\_asc\_desc: Whether the order is ascending or descending


**Response**

accounts: An array of Account objects

  - id: ID of the account

  - account\_name: Name of account

  - brand: The brand that is associated with this account

  - your\_reference: Your unique customer ID

  - status: Status of the account

  - street: First line of the address

  - city: City

  - state\_or\_province: Name of state or province

  - country: Country

  - postal\_code: Post Code or Zip code

  - spread\_table: Name of spread table

  - created\_at: ISO 8601 Date when the Account was created

  - updated\_at: ISO 8601 Date when the Account was last updated

  - identification\_type: Name of ID type

  - identification\_value: ID value

  - short\_reference: shortened reference

pagination: Pagination details relevant to the search query

  - total\_entries: Total entries for this search query

  - total\_pages: Total pages for this search query

  - current\_page: Current page of the search query

  - per\_page: Amount of search results to return per page

  - previous\_page: Previous page for this search query

  - next\_page: Next page for this search query

  - order: Order of the search returned for this search query

  - order\_asc\_desc: Order of results returned e.g. 'asc' or 'desc'

**POST /v2/authenticate/api** - Generates an auth token for the api user which needs to be used in all subsequent calls.

**Required fields:**

login\_id - The login id of the user

api\_key - A unique value that is the user's api key

**Response:**

auth\_token - The auth token to use on subsequent requests

[View Documentation](https://beta.currencycloud.com/documentation/api-docs/post-authenticate-api)

**POST /v2/authenticate/login** - Generates an auth token for the contact which needs to be used in all subsequent calls.

**Required fields:**

nonce - The nonce for the authentication request

security\_answer - The answer for the question retrieved from /authentication/user

password - The password for the user

**Response:**

auth\_token - The auth token to use on subsequent requests

**GET /v2/authenticate/user** - Retrieves a security question to be displayed to the user. The user must answer the question successfully to be able to log in.

**Required fields:**

login\_id - The login id of the user


**Response:**

nonce - A short-lived token that is used for a subsequent login request.

security\_code - An enumeration that identifies the security question

security\_question - A security question in English that needs to be answered for a successful login

**POST /v2/authenticate/close\_session** - All sessions must come to an end, either manually using the 'close session' call, or by timing out. If you know that the session is no longer required, for example because the end-user wants to logout, it is good practise to explicitly close the session rather than leaving it to time-out.

**GET /v2/balances/{currency}** - Provides the balance for a currency and shows the date that the balance was last updated.

**Required Fields**

currency - 3 digit ISO 4217 currency code

**Response**

id - Unique ID

account\_id - Unique ID of related account

currency - 3 character ISO 4217 currency code

amount - Amount of balance to 2dp

created\_at - ISO8601 date when the balance was created

updated\_at - ISO8601 date when the balance was last updated

**GET /v2/balances/find** - Search for a range of balances and receive a paged response. This is useful if you want to see historic balances.

**Optional Fields**

amount\_from - Amount of balances to 2dp

amount\_to - Amount of balances to 2dp

as\_at\_date - ISO8601 Date Time to view balances at a specific point in time.

page - Which page to show

per\_page - Maximum number of entries to return

order - The field to order entries by

order\_asc\_desc - Whether the order is ascending or descending.

**Response**

balances - An array of balance objects:

- id - Unique ID
- account\_id - Unique ID of related account
- currency - 3 character ISO4217 currency code
- amount - Amount of balance to 2dp
- created\_at - ISO8601 Date when the balance was created
- updated\_at - ISO8601 Date when the balance was last updated

pagination - Pagination details relevant to the search query:

- total\_entries - Total entries for this search query
- total\_pages - Total pages for this search query
- current\_page - Current page of the search query
- per\_page - Amount of search results to return per page
- previous\_page - Previous page for this search query
- next\_page - Next page for this search query
- order - Order of the search returned for this search query
- order\_asc\_desc - Order of results returned

**GET /v2/contacts/{id}** - Returns a json structure containing the details of the requested contact.


**Required Fields**

id: ID of the contact

**Response**

id: ID of the contact

account\_name: Account name

account\_id: ID of the account

your\_reference: Your unique ID

email\_address: Email address

first\_name: First name

last\_name: Last name

phone\_number: Phone number

mobile\_phone\_number: Mobile phone number

locale: The locale of the user as combination of an ISO 639-1 language code and ISO\_3166-1 regional code e.g. en, en-US, fr-FR

login\_id: Login ID

status: Status

timezone: The timezone of the user as it exists in the IANA tz database e.g. Europe/London, America/New\_York (reference http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/List\_of\_tz\_database\_time\_zones#List)

date\_of\_birth: DOB of contact

created\_at: ISO 8601 Date when the Contact was created

updated\_at: ISO 8601 Date when the Contact was last updated

**POST /v2/contacts/create** - Creates a new contact and returns a hash containing the details of the requested contact.

**Required Fields**

account\_id: ID of the account

first\_name: First name

last\_name: Last name

email\_address: Email address

phone\_number: Phone number

**Optional Fields**

your\_reference: Your unique ID

mobile\_phone\_number: Mobile phone number

item.name: Reset security details for a Contact

request.description:
**POST /v2/contacts/reset\_security\_details** - Resets the users details if the token is valid contact.

**Required Fields**

token - The unique and temporary token that identifies this reset security details request

password - The password to use for the user

security\_question\_one - One of the four allowed security questions (sec\_q\_fav\_city, sec\_q\_pet\_name, sec\_q\_fav\_animal, sec\_q\_hol\_dst)

security\_question\_two - One of the four allowed security questions (sec\_q\_fav\_city, sec\_q\_pet\_name, sec\_q\_fav\_animal, sec\_q\_hol\_dst)

security\_question\_three - One of the four allowed security questions (sec\_q\_fav\_city, sec\_q\_pet\_name, sec\_q\_fav\_animal, sec\_q\_hol\_dst)

security\_answer\_one - The answer for security\_answer\_one

security\_answer\_two - The answer for security\_answer\_two

security\_answer\_three - The answer for security\_answer\_three

**Response**

**GET /v2/contacts/security\_details** - Returns a json structure with all the security questions for the active contact


**Response**

security\_questions - The list of security questions for the currently logged in user

- security\_code - An enumeration (sec\_q\_hol\_dst, sec\_q\_fav\_animal, sec\_q\_pet\_name, sec\_q\_fav\_city) that identifies the security question

- security\_question - A security question in English that needs to be answered for a successful login.

formdata.value: Cancel due to very important reason

request.description:
**POST /v2/conversions/:id/cancel** 
    Returns a json structure containing the details of the conversion cancellation.


**Required Fields**

id: conversion ID should be passed as a part of URL. It is needed to identify, which conversion we are going to cancel.

**Optional Fields**

note: the reason why conversion is cancelled


**Response**

account\_id: account ID that the Conversion belongs to

contact\_id: contact ID that the Conversion belongs to

conversion\_id: ID of the conversions which was cancelled

amount: profit or loss amount

currency: ISO-4217 three letter profit or loss currency

notes: notes that were provided as a reason of cancellation

event\_date\_time: Datetime of conversion cancellation event

formdata.value: Cancel due to very important reason

request.description:
**GERT /v2/conversions/:id/cancellation_quote** 
    Returns a json structure containing the details of the conversion cancellation rate.


**Required Fields**

id: conversion ID should be passed as a part of URL. It is needed to identify, which conversion we are going to cancel.

**Optional Fields**

None


**Response**

amount: profit or loss amount

currency: ISO-4217 three letter profit or loss currency

event\_date\_time: Datetime of conversion cancellation event

**GET /v2/conversions/:id/date_change_quote** 
    Returns a json structure containing the details of the conversion date change rate.

**Required Fields**

new\_settlement\_date: New settlement date for the Conversion.

**Optional Fields**

None

conversion\_id: ID of the Conversion

amount: Amount of Profit or Loss (positive or negative)

currency: ISO-4217 three letter profit or loss currency

new\_conversion\_date: Datetime of new conversion date

new\_settlement\_date: Datetime of new settlement date

old\_conversion\_date: Datetime of old conversion date

old\_settlement\_date: Datetime of old settlement date

event\_date\_time: Datetime of conversion date change quote event

**POST /v2/conversions/:id/date_change** 
    Returns a json structure containing the details of the conversion date change rate.

**Required Fields**

id: conversion ID should be passed as a part of URL. It is needed to identify for which conversion we are going to change settlement date.

new\_settlement\_date: New settlement date for the Conversion.

**Optional Fields**

None

**Response**

conversion\_id: ID of the Conversion

amount: Amount of Profit or Loss (positive or negative)

currency: ISO-4217 three letter profit or loss currency

new\_conversion\_date: Datetime of new conversion date

new\_settlement\_date: Datetime of new settlement date

old\_conversion\_date: Datetime of old conversion date

old\_settlement\_date: Datetime of old settlement date

event\_date\_time: Datetime of conversion date change quote event

**GET /v2/conversions/profit_and_loss** Return an array containing json structures of details of the conversion profit and losses matching the search criteria for the logged in user. **Required Fields** None **Optional Fields** account\_id: ID of the Account that the Conversion belongs to contact\_id: ID of the Contact that did the cancellation conversion\_id: ID of the cancelled conversion event\_type: Event type. Can be one from following list - self\_service\_cancellation, automated\_date\_change, back\_office\_cancellation event\_date\_time\_from: Allows you to return profit and losses will be done from on or after a defined date/time. ISO 8601 standard event\_date\_time\_to: Allows you to return profit and losses will be done from on or before a defined date/time. ISO 8601 standard amount\_from: Allows you to return profit and losses based on a minimum profit or loss amount amount\_to: Allows you to return profit and losses based on a maximum profit or loss amount currency: The currency being purchsed in a conversion. ISO 4217 standard scope: Scope allows contacts to search all profit and losses at all account levels. Defaults to own.
own: allows to search profit and losses on the main account
clients: allows to search profit and losses of account sub accounts
all: allows to search balances profit and losses account and sub-accounts **Response** conversion\_profit\_and\_losses: An array of Conversion Profit and Losses entities. account\_id: account ID that the Conversion belongs to contact\_id: contact ID that the Conversion belongs to conversion\_id: ID of the conversions which was cancelled event\_type: Type of cancellation amount: profit or loss amount currency: ISO-4217 three letter profit or loss currency notes: notes that were provided as a reason of cancellation event\_date\_time: Datetime of conversion cancellation event pagination:Pagination details relevant to the search query total\_entries:Total entries for this search query total\_pages:Total pages for this search query current\_page:Current page of the search query per\_page:Amount of search results to return per page previous\_page:Previous page for this search query next\_page:Next page for this search query order :Order of the search returned for this search query order\_asc\_desc:Order of results returned e.g. 'asc' or 'desc'

**Response**

first\_conversion\_date: The first delivery date that a conversion can be executed on

currencies

currency - The 3 character ISO 4217 currency code of a specific settlement account

  - bank\_address: Bank address

  - bank\_country: Bank country

invalid\_payment\_dates: A list of dates and reasons why a payment can not occur.

**GET /v2/reference/payer_required_details** - Returns required payer details and their basic validation formats.

item.name: Customer Reporting
item.description:
**/v2/customer_reporting/**
Reporting functionality that allows to generate Payment and Conversion Reports according to provided search options.
In addition, it allows to retrieve previously generated reports by ID or by specified search options

formdata.value: Test Conversions Report created in purpose of testing  :)

request.description:
**GET /v2/customer_reporting/conversions/create  ** 
   Creates new Conversions Report entity

**Required Fields**

	None

**Optional Fields**

	description:Description that will be applied to report
	
	buy\_currency:Conversion buy currency. 3 character ISO 4217 currency code
	
	sell\_currency:Conversion sell currency. 3 character ISO 4217 currency code
	
	client\_buy\_amount\_from:Client buy amount range start
	
	client\_buy\_amount\_to:Client buy amount range end
	
	client\_sell\_amount\_from:Client sell amount range start
	
	client\_sell\_amount\_to:Client sell amount range end
	
	partner\_buy\_amount\_from:Partner buy amount range start
	
	partner\_buy\_amount\_to:Partner buy amount range end
	
	partner\_sell\_amount\_from:Partner sell amount range start
	
	partner\_sell\_amount\_to:Partner sell amount range end
	
	client\_status:The current status of the Conversion
	
	partner\_status:The current status of the Conversion
	
	conversion\_date\_from:Conversion date range start. ISO 8601 Datetime when buy currency was delivered
	
	conversion\_date\_to:Conversion date range end. ISO 8601 Datetime when buy currency was delivered
	
	settlement\_date\_from:Conversion settlement date range start. ISO 8601 Datetime when the sell_currency was debited
	
	settlement\_date\_to:Conversion settlement date range end. ISO 8601 Datetime when the sell_currency was debited
	
	created\_at\_from:Payment creation date start
	
	created\_at\_to:Payment creation date end
	
	updated\_at\_from:ISO 8601 Start Datetime when the payment was updated
	
	updated\_at\_to:ISO 8601 End Datetime when the payment was updated

	unique\_request\_id:Payment unique request ID
	
	scope:Specifies which account level will be used; 'own' is a default value

**Response**
	New Payments Report entity:

	id:Report unique ID

	short\_reference:Human readable unique ID
	
	description:Text that was provided as a reason of Report generation
	
	search\_params:The list of options that were provided for filtering of entities that user searching for (payments, conversions, beneficiaries, transactions)
	
	report\_type:Type of the Report (payment, conversion, beneficiary or transaction)
	
	status:Status of the Report (processing, completed or expired)
	
	expiration\_date:Date when the Report expires
	
	report\_url:URL that allows you to download generated report
	
	account\_id:ID of the Account that the Report belongs to
	
	contact\_id:ID of the Contact that the Report belongs to
	
	created\_at:Datetime of when the Report was created
	
	updated\_at:Datetime of when the Report was last updated

item.name: IBAN's
item.description:
**/v2/ibans/**
International Bank Account Number API. It provides ability to retrieve IBANS that belongs to you or your sub-accounts.

request.description:
**GET /v2/ibans** - Returns a JSON structure containing the details of the IBAN assigned to the logged in account.

**Optional Fields**

currency: Currency in which the balance is held, this must be 3 characters long. Currency codes are ISO 4217 standard.

**Response**

ibans: An array of IBAN objects;

  uuid: IBAN unique identifier.
  
  iban\_code: Code of the IBAN.
  
  account\_id: ID of the account that IBAN belongs to.
  
  currency: Currency in which the balance is held, this must be 3 characters long. Currency codes are ISO 4217 standard.
  
  account\_holder\_name: Account holder name.
  
  bank\_institution\_name: Bank name.
  
  bank\_institution\_address: Bank address.
  
  bank\_institution\_country: Bank country.
  
  bic\_swift: Bank identification code.
  
  created\_at: Date and Time of creation.
  
  updated\_at: Date and Time of last update.

  order\_asc\_desc:Order of results returned e.g. 'asc' or 'desc'

**GET /v2/ibans/subaccounts/{id}** - Returns a JSON structure containing the details of the IBAN assigned to a specific sub-account linked to a house account.

**Required Fields**

id: Sub-Account UUID.

**Response**

ibans: An array of IBAN objects;

  uuid: IBAN unique identifier.
  
  iban\_code: Code of the IBAN.
  
  account\_id: ID of the account that IBAN belongs to.
  
  currency: Currency in which the balance is held, this must be 3 characters long. Currency codes are ISO 4217 standard.
  
  account\_holder\_name: Account holder name.
  
  bank\_institution\_name: Bank name.
